name: Maasai Beaded Kenyan Flag Snap-On Bracelet
description:
Fly the Kenya flag colors with this traditional beaded band for men or women. 

Handmade in traditional Maasai style as the women have done in  villages for generations. Sales of this item benefit the widows of Maji Moto Village in the Loita Hills near Maasai Mara, Kenya.  

(8" L x 1.5" W)

name: Eco Funky Flip Flop Bangle
description:
From discarded flip flop to artsy fashion statement…these cushy oversized bangles in horizontal or vertical stripes are a fun accent to your wardrobe, while celebrating your joy in helping heal the impact of trash on our world’s environment.

(One Size, approximately 4” outside diameter)

Created by UniquEco, also known as The (Flipflop) Recycling Design Company, engages the creativity of local people in Kenya to turn mankind’s waste into something beautiful and useful.  The world is blighted by manmade products, momentarily useful then discarded, leaving a scar on the land or sea. The poorest parts of the world often suffer the worst environmental degradation. The flipflop is the most basic footwear for many in the world, yet every day hundreds of brightly colored, non-degradable pieces of rubber wash up on Kenyan beaches from as far away as China and Indonesia, damaging coastlines, the lives of local coastal people and the marine and coastal ecology. Even more discarded flip flops are piled in the trash heaps of the poorest Nairobi communities. Through UniquEco, local women and children collect the rubbish, and creatively  turn this waste into cool jewelry, decorations, luggage tags and more. Belief in the importance of developing business skills at the local level for long-term development is at the heart of UniquEco, as they provide job training, and employment.

name: African Yellow Zip Bag
description:
A perfectly zippered fully lined pouch for pencils, makeup…anything to store away neatly in your purse, backpack or desk. Created from brilliant yellow and red African Kanga cloth. 

(6.5” x. 3.75”)

Created by SOKO, a tailoring school and production house DIani, on the Kenyan coast. They work with fashion designers around the world to produce quality garments and accessories while improving life for some of Kenya’s poorest people, in a community that currently has 50% employment, through vocational training, employment, and social services.   SOKO aims to create a sustainable and creative long term solution to Kenya’s economic crisis by promoting community driven, ethical and environmentally aware trade in fashion. Learn more about SOKO at www.soko-kenya.com.

name: Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda Soaps Gift Set
description:
A new shipment has just arrived from Nepal!

A rich sampler selection of Laavanya's 5 soaps: Yak Milk & Himalayan Flower (grounding and calming), Nettle & Spearmint (skin blemishes, cooling, antibacterial), Saffron Turmeric (beautifying skin, clearing blemishes and pigmentation), Sandalwood & Rose (sunburn relief, cooling and anti-inflammatory), and Tuberose & Turmeric (healing infections and wounds, cooling and rejuvenating). 

Soaps are handcrafted in Nepal, using the finest herbs and natural ingredients sourced from the sacred Himalayas. The set comes beautifully packaged in a hand made box, perfect for storing jewelry and other treasures after using the soap.

Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda products are all natural (no artificial colors, preservatives or petrochemicals), earth-friendly (not from wild endangered plants, packaging is recyclable, reusable), dharmic (free from animal testing), and humanitarian (respectful and supportive of local farmers, suppliers, manufacturers, and artisans).

name: Eco Flip Flop Coral Design Necklace
description:
This funky lightweight necklace adds a splash of color and creativity to your wardrobe. Reminiscent of coral designs, it is made from the soft foam of recycled flipflops discarded in Kenya, finished with a suede cord. You'll be supporting not just your style, but a cleaner environment as well.  

See the matching bracelet too!

Length: 14"

Created by UniquEco, also known as The (Flipflop) Recycling Design Company, engages the creativity of local people in Kenya to turn mankind’s waste into something beautiful and useful. Even more discarded flip flops are piled in the trash heaps of the poorest Nairobi communities. Belief in the importance of developing business skills at the local level for long-term development is at the heart of UniquEco, as they provide job training, and employment.

name: Kenyan Painted Wood Coasters
description:
Hand crafted wooden coasters, painted in bright African patterns by former street kids of Nairobi who now put their creativity to use to earn a living and express their art. Set of 6 coasters in a matching storage rack.

(4” x 4” coasters, in 4.75” x 4.75” storage rack)

Created by Streetwise, in Nairobi, Kenya where kids “cross over to the other side of the street” by using their talents and determination to earn money from the sale of handmade products to support themselves, rather than live a life on the streets.  Started in 1994, when street children from a local rescue center attended weekly after school art session to paint pots, the project has grown to a full time operation led by some of the first boys from the project. Ishmael is one of these boys, found on the streets of Nairobi sniffing glue and surviving however he could, until his artistic talent was discovered. He is now a leader of the organization, helping others get off the street through Streetwise where boys and girls learn literacy and numeracy skills and how to paint and sew. Older members are often sponsored to go to college and further tailoring courses. By buying a Streetwise item you are helping these teens secure a better future.

name: Kenyan Painted Frames
description:
Hand crafted wooden photo frames, painted in bright African patterns by former street kids of Nairobi who now put their creativity to use to earn a living and express their art. 

(4” x 6”)

Created by Streetwise, in Nairobi, Kenya where kids “cross over to the other side of the street” by using their talents and determination to earn money from the sale of handmade products to support themselves, rather than live a life on the streets. name: Kenyan Kanga Apron
description:
Spice up your cooking with these vibrant Kenyan cloth aprons. 

The Yellow kanga cloth style includes the Swahili proverb that means "I am afraid of the lion's teeth, but not of his roar",  reminding us of the difference between real and imagined dangers. 

Also available in Blue Kanga and Teal Batik. 

(One size, 30" from bib to hem)

Created by SOKO, a tailoring school and production house DIani, on the Kenyan coast. They work with fashion designers around the world to produce quality garments and accessories while improving life for some of Kenya’s poorest people, in a community that currently has 50% employment, through vocational training, employment, and social services. description:

(3” W x 3.5” H)

name: Indian Tussar Silk Pillows
description:
These rich and unique pillows are crafted from Tussar silk and brocades created in northern India, which are then sewn and hand block printed in gold patterns in the southern state of Tamil Nadu. They are a perfect accent for your living room, bedroom, any room.

(16”x16”x4")

Shipping Time: 7-10 days

name: Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda Soap
description:
Soaps are handcrafted in Nepal, using the finest herbs and natural ingredients sourced from the sacred Himalayas. Each soap comes beautifully packaged in a hand made box, perfect for storing jewelry and other treasures after using the soap.

~ Himalayan Flower Yak Milk: Deeply nourish and hydrate the skin with this rich lather milk soap.  

~ Nettle and Spearmint: Nettle has traditionally been used to cure and treat skin conditions from blemishes to eczema. Spearmint oil is cooling and antibacterial.

~ Sandalwood and Rose: Perfect for sunburned skin due to cooling and anti-inflammatory properties.

~ Saffron Turmeric: These are considered the best herbs for beautifying the skin, and added nutmeg treats skin problems such as blemishes and pigmentations. 

Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda products are all natural (no artificial colors, preservatives or petrochemicals), earth-friendly (not from wild endangered plants, packaging is recyclable, reusable), dharmic (free from animal testing), and humanitarian (respectful and supportive of local farmers, suppliers, manufacturers, and artisans).

(3"x3"x1" - 80 gms)

name: Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda Bath Salts
description:
Bath salts are a mix of Himalayan salt and therapeutic herbs and essential oils. Himalayan salt is believed to consist of more than 50 minerals and is one of the purest forms of salt because it is free of industrial pollutants and impurities. It is rich in health promoting properties such as healing, anti-inflammatory, muscle relaxant and powerful detoxifying agents. 

Laavanya Luxury Ayurveda products are all natural (no artificial colors, preservatives or petrochemicals), earth-friendly (not from wild endangered plants, packaging is recyclable, reusable), dharmic (free from animal testing), and humanitarian (respectful and supportive of local farmers, suppliers, manufacturers, and artisans).

(100 gms)
